original: Sutta Nipāta 1.4
analyzed: sutta nipāta
translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .

original: Kasibhāradvājasutta
analyzed: kasi bhāradvājasutta
translated: The Discussion with the Ploughman Bhāradvāja

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard:

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā magadhesu viharati dakkhiṇāgirismiṁ ekanāḷāyaṁ brāhmaṇagāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā magadhesu viharati dakkhiṇāgirismin ekanāḷāyam brāhmaṇagāme
translated: At one time the Blessed One was staying in the Magadhan lands at Dakkhiṇāgiri, in the Brahmins’ village of Ekanāḷa.

original: Tena kho pana samayena kasibhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa pañcamattāni naṅgalasatāni payuttāni honti vappakāle.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena kasibhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa pañcamattāni naṅgala satāni payuttāni honti vappa kāle
translated: Now at that time, as it was the time for ploughing, five hundred ploughs of the Brahmin Bhāradvāja were yoked.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena kasibhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa kammanto tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena kasi bhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa kammantaḥ tena upasaṅkami
translated: Then, in the morning, the Blessed One dressed, took his bowl and robe, and went to the place where the Brahmin Bhāradvāja was working.

original: Tena kho pana samayena kasibhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa parivesanā vattati.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena kasibhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa parivesanā vattati
translated: Now at that time a meal was being prepared for the Blessed One in the Brahmin Bhāradvāja’s house.

original: Atha kho bhagavā yena parivesanā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā yena parivesanā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi
translated: Then the Blessed One went to the place where the meal was being prepared and stood to one side.

original: Addasā kho kasibhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ piṇḍāya ṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: addasā kho kasibhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam piṇḍāya ṭhita
translated: The Brahmin Bhāradvāja saw the Blessed One standing for alms,

original: Disvāna bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: disvāna bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said to him:

original: “ahaṁ kho, samaṇa, kasāmi ca vapāmi ca; kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmi.
analyzed: aham kho samaṇa kasāmi ca vapāmi ca kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmi
translated: “I plough and sow, ascetic, and when I have ploughed and sown I eat.

original: Tvampi, samaṇa, kasassu ca vapassu ca; kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjassū”ti.
analyzed: tvam pi samaṇa kasassu ca vapassu ca kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjassu iti
translated: You should also plow and sow, and then you can eat.”

original: “Ahampi kho, brāhmaṇa, kasāmi ca vapāmi ca; kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmī”ti.
analyzed: aham pi khalu brāhmaṇa kasāmi ca vapāmi ca kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmi iti
translated: “Brahmin, I too plow and sow, and then I eat.”

original: “Na kho pana mayaṁ passāma bhoto gotamassa yugaṁ vā naṅgalaṁ vā phālaṁ vā pācanaṁ vā balībadde vā.
analyzed: na kho pana mayam passāma bhoto gotamassa yugam vā naṅgalam vā phālam vā pācanam vā balībadde vā
translated: “But we don’t see Master Gotama’s yoke, plow, or plowshare; his oxen or goad.

original: Atha ca pana bhavaṁ gotamo evamāha:🔽‘ahampi kho, brāhmaṇa, kasāmi ca vapāmi ca; kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmī’”ti.
analyzed: atha ca pana bhavam gotamaḥ evam āha  aham pi khalu brāhmaṇa kasāmi ca vapāmi ca kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmi iti
translated: And yet he says this.”

original: Atha kho kasibhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
analyzed: atha kho kasibhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam gāthāya ajjhabhāsi
translated: “Then the brahmin Kasibharadvaja addressed the Buddha in verse:

original: “Kassako paṭijānāsi,
analyzed: kassakaḥ paṭijānāsi
translated: “You claim to be a farmer,

original: na ca passāma te kasiṁ;
analyzed: na ca passāma te kasi
translated: but we don’t see your farming.

original: Kasiṁ no pucchito brūhi,
analyzed: kasim naḥ pucchitaḥ brūhi
translated: When asked about your farming,

original: yathā jānemu te kasiṁ”.
analyzed: yathā jānemu te kasi
translated: tell us about it so we may know your farming.”

original: “Saddhā bījaṁ tapo vuṭṭhi,
analyzed: saddhā bījam tapaḥ vuṭṭhi
translated: “Faith is my seed, austerity my rain,

original: paññā me yuganaṅgalaṁ;🔽Hirī īsā mano yottaṁ,🔽sati me phālapācanaṁ.
analyzed: paññā me yuga naṅgala  hirī īsā manaḥ  sati me phālapācana
translated: wisdom my yoke and plow,🔽conscience my pole, mind my yoke-tie,

original: Kāyagutto vacīgutto,
analyzed: kāya guttaḥ vacī guttaḥ
translated: mindfulness my plowshare and goad.🔽Guarding the doors of my senses,

original: āhāre udare yato;
analyzed: āhāre udare yato
translated: moderate in eating,

original: Saccaṁ karomi niddānaṁ,
analyzed: saccam karomi niddāna
translated: I make truth my weeding-hook,

original: soraccaṁ me pamocanaṁ.🔽Vīriyaṁ me dhuradhorayhaṁ,
analyzed: soraccam me pamocana  vīriyam me
translated: Gentleness is my ploughshare.🔽My energy is my draught ox,

original: yogakkhemādhivāhanaṁ;
analyzed: yoga kkhema adhivāhana
translated: Which carries me to the state of safety.

original: Gacchati anivattantaṁ,
analyzed: gacchati anivattanta
translated: It goes without turning back,

original: yattha gantvā na socati.
analyzed: yattha gantvā na socati
translated: Where, having gone, one does not grieve.

original: Evamesā kasī kaṭṭhā,
analyzed: evam esā kasī kaṭṭhā
translated: Thus this ploughing is ploughing,

original: Sā hoti amatapphalā;
analyzed: sā hoti amata phalā
translated: Which has the fruit of the deathless.

original: Etaṁ kasiṁ kasitvāna,
analyzed: etam kasim kasitvāna
translated: Having ploughed this ploughing,

original: Sabbadukkhā pamuccatī”ti.
analyzed: sabba dukkhā pamuccati iti
translated: One is freed from all suffering.”

original: Atha kho kasibhāradvājo brāhmaṇo mahatiyā kaṁsapātiyā pāyasaṁ vaḍḍhetvā bhagavato upanāmesi:
analyzed: atha kho kasibhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ mahatiyā kasapātiyā pāyasam vaḍḍhetvā bhagavataḥ upanāmesi
translated: Then the brahmin Kasibharadvaja, having had rice gruel thickened with ghee brought in a golden bowl, presented it to the Blessed One, saying:

original: “bhuñjatu bhavaṁ gotamo pāyasaṁ.🔽Kassako bhavaṁ;
analyzed: bhuñjatu bhavam gotamaḥ pāyasa  kassakaḥ bhava
translated: “May Master Gotama eat rice gruel.🔽Master Gotama is a ploughman;

original: yañhi bhavaṁ gotamo amatapphalaṁ kasiṁ kasatī”ti.
analyzed: yat hi bhavam gotamaḥ amata phalam kasim kasati iti
translated: for Master Gotama ploughs for the supreme furrow.”

original: “Gāthābhigītaṁ me abhojaneyyaṁ,
analyzed: gāthā abhigītam me abhojaneyya
translated: “What is chanted by the brahmins, that is not fit to be eaten;

original: Sampassataṁ brāhmaṇa nesa dhammo;
analyzed: sampassatam brāhmaṇa na isa dhammaḥ
translated: This is not the brahmins’ doctrine, when they see it.

original: Gāthābhigītaṁ panudanti buddhā,
analyzed: gāthā abhigītam panudanti buddhāḥ
translated: The Buddhas reject what is chanted by the brahmins;

original: Dhamme satī brāhmaṇa vuttiresā.
analyzed: dhamme satī brāhmaṇa vuttiḥ esā
translated: This is the brahmins’ doctrine, when they see it.

original: Aññena ca kevalinaṁ mahesiṁ,
analyzed: aññena ca kevalinam mahesi
translated: But one who serves with food and drink

original: Khīṇāsavaṁ kukkuccavūpasantaṁ;
analyzed: khīṇa āsavam
translated: The one who is perfect, the great seer,

original: Annena pānena upaṭṭhahassu,
analyzed: annena pānena upaṭṭhahassu
translated: The one whose taints are destroyed, who is free from doubt,

original: Khettaṁ hi taṁ puññapekkhassa hotī”ti.
analyzed: khettam hi tam puññapekkhassa hoti iti
translated: Is a field of merit for one who seeks merit.”

original: “Atha kassa cāhaṁ, bho gotama, imaṁ pāyasaṁ dammī”ti?
analyzed: atha kassa ca āha bho gotama imam pāyasam dammi iti
translated: “Then to whom should I give this milk-rice?”

original: “Na khvāhaṁ taṁ, brāhmaṇa, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā
analyzed: na khvā aham ta brāhmaṇa passāmi sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇiyā
translated: “Brahmin, I do not see that person in this world—with its devas, Māras, and Brahmās, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, its devas and humans—

original: pajāya sadevamanussāya, yassa so pāyaso bhutto sammā pariṇāmaṁ gaccheyya, aññatra
analyzed: pajāya sa deva manussāya yassa so pāyasaḥ bhutto sammā pariṇāmam gaccheyya aññatra
translated: in whose stomach this milk-rice, when eaten, would properly digest, except in

original: tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā.
analyzed: tathāgatassa vā tathāgata sāvakassa vā
translated: a Tathāgata or a Tathāgata’s disciple.

original: Tena hi tvaṁ, brāhmaṇa, taṁ pāyasaṁ appaharite vā chaḍḍehi appāṇake vā udake opilāpehī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi tva brāhmaṇa tam pāyasam appaharite vā chaḍḍehi appāṇake vā udake opilāpehi iti
translated: Therefore, brahmin, throw that milk-rice away where there is but little grass, or dump it into water with few living creatures.”

original: Atha kho kasibhāradvājo brāhmaṇo taṁ pāyasaṁ appāṇake udake opilāpesi.
analyzed: atha kho kasibhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tam pāyasam appāṇake udake opilāpesi
translated: Then the brahmin Kasibhāradvāja dumped that milk-rice into water with few living creatures.

original: Atha kho so pāyaso udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati.
analyzed: atha kho so pāyasaḥ udake pakkhittaḥ cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati
translated: Then that milk-rice, when dumped into the water, hissed and sizzled and seethed and steamed.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma phālo divasaṁ santatto udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma phālaḥ divasam santattaḥ udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati
translated: Just as an iron ball heated all day, when thrown into water, hisses and sizzles and seethes and steams,

original: evamevaṁ so pāyaso udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati.🔽Atha kho kasibhāradvājo brāhmaṇo saṁviggo lomahaṭṭhajāto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam evam saḥ pāyasaḥ udake pakkhittaḥ cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati  atha kho kasibhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ sa viggaḥ lomahaṭṭha jātaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavataḥ pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and as it was being poured into the water, it hissed and sizzled and steamed and smoked.

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.🔽Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama  seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: Then the brahmin Kasibharadvaja, trembling and with his hair standing on end, went to the Blessed One and, on arrival, having bowed down to him, said, “Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent!

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya, ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms,

original: evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: in the same way has Master Gotama — through many lines of reasoning — made the Dhamma clear.

original: Esāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca,
analyzed: esā aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go to Master Gotama for refuge, to the Dhamma, and to the Saṅgha of monks.

original: labheyyāhaṁ bhoto gotamassa santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyaṁ upasampadan”ti.
analyzed: labheyya aham bhoto gotamassa santike pabbajja labheyyam upasampadanti
translated: May Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”

original: Alattha kho kasibhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, alattha upasampadaṁ.🔽Acirūpasampanno kho panāyasmā bhāradvājo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto🔽viharanto nacirasseva—yassatthāya kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti,
analyzed: alattha kho kasibhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavato santike pabbajja alattha upasampada  acira upasampannaḥ kho pana āyasmā bhāradvājaḥ ekaḥ vūpakaṭṭhaḥ appamattaḥ ātāpī pahitatto  viharantaḥ kula puttā sammad eva agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajanti
translated: The brahmin Kasibhāradvāja received the going forth in the presence of the Buddha, he received full ordination.🔽Not long after his full ordination, while dwelling solitary, secluded, heedful, ardent, and resolute,

original: tadanuttaraṁ—brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
analyzed: tad anuttara brahmacariya pariyosānam diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi
translated: the venerable Bhāradvāja, by realising for himself with direct knowledge, here and now entered upon and abided in that supreme goal of the holy life for the sake of which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: “Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā”ti abbhaññāsi.
analyzed: vusitam brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati
translated: He directly knew: “Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.”

original: Aññataro ca panāyasmā bhāradvājo arahataṁ ahosīti.🔽Kasibhāradvājasuttaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: aññataro ca pana ayasmai bhāradvājaḥ arahatam ahosi iti 🔽kasibhāradvājasuttam
translated: And the venerable Bhāradvāja became one of the arahants.🔽The Sutta with Kasibhāradvāja is finished.
